item.title: Russians and Ukrainians in Berlin celebrate Victory Day
item.description: Former Soviet nations commemorate the end of World War II on 9 May while most European countries remember the defeat of Nazi Germany a day earlier. A difference that seemed unimportant until now.
item.keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content, Russia, Ukraine, war, rememberance, history, WW2, WWII, world war, soviet army, Germany, Berlin
item.media:title: Russians and Ukrainians in Berlin celebrate Victory Day
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,Russia, Ukraine, war, rememberance, history, WW2, WWII, world war, soviet army, Germany, Berlin

item.title: Employer surveillance – the boss is watching you!
item.description: More and more companies worldwide are using software to monitor employees performance. These programs can track your screen activity, chats, mails – and even access webcams. Could your boss be spying on you?
item.keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content, office, software, work, business, surveillance, remote office, mobile office, trust, employment rights
item.media:title: Employer surveillance – the boss is watching you!
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,office, software, work, business, surveillance, remote office, mobile office, trust, employment rights

item.title: Censored War News – Hidden for Russians in Online Game!
item.description: A Finnish newspaper put information censored by Russia into the online game "Counter-Strike."
item.keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content, Russia, war, censorship, Ukraine, Counter-Strike, gaming, FPS, video game
item.media:title: Censored War News – Hidden for Russians in Online Game!
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,Russia, war, censorship, Ukraine, Counter-Strike, gaming, FPS, video game

item.title: Gay activist flees to Germany to escape Kremlin repression
item.description: The Kremlin has increasingly targeted Russia’s queer community during the war in Ukraine. Those who can, like Piotr Voskresensky flee the country. DW met him just after he arrived in Germany.
item.keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content, Russia, freedom, activist, activism, LGBTQ+, human rights, oppression, suppression
item.media:title: Gay activist flees to Germany to escape Kremlin repression
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,Russia, freedom, activist, activism, LGBTQ+, human rights, oppression, suppression

item.title: What kind of Turkey do young people want?
item.description: Voters under 25 could swing what is expected to be a tight race in Turkey’s upcoming general election.
item.keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content, Turkey, election, voters, young voters, Erdogan, social media, generation z, cost of living, inflation
item.media:title: What kind of Turkey do young people want?
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,Turkey, election, voters, young voters, Erdogan, social media, generation z, cost of living, inflation

item.title: Are Russian bots manipulating Turkish social media?
item.description: Thousands of Russian-speaking Twitter accounts that had been previously inactive have been reopened as Turkish accounts. This is weeks ahead of the May 14 elections in Turkey, raising fears about possible election manipulation through social media.
item.keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content, Russia, Turkey, election, foreign, interference, influence, pre-election, manipulation, social media
item.media:title: Are Russian bots manipulating Turkish social media?
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,Russia, Turkey, election, foreign, interference, influence, pre-election, manipulation, social media

item.title: Hunting Kashmir's 'mushroom gold' Morchella
item.description: Morchella mushrooms are among the most expensive in the world. Two mushroom hunters talk to DW about their day jobs.

item.title: The health hazard in Indonesian instant noodles
item.description: In some packets of Indomie noodles, ethylene oxide was detected. Exposure to ethylene oxide can lead to cancer.

item.title: The dark side of tourism
item.description: With Portugal being Europe’s top tourism destination, Lisbon has become too expensive for its own residents to live in.
